question_text: Which two situations most likely require active signal conversion instead of passive adaptation? (Select two)
answer_options: Connecting DVI-D output to VGA monitor
Using DVI-A to connect to an older CRT display
Sending HDMI to a VGA projector
Attaching a USB hub to a USB-A port
correct_answer: Connecting DVI-D output to VGA monitor
Sending HDMI to a VGA projector
explanation: Both DVI-D and HDMI are digital, while VGA is analog. These conversions require signal converters to bridge the signal type gap.
